column4: Hi, the vmware-player package in ubuntu won't install here and worth of it, it won't uninstall and blocks other packages.
!vmware-player
pastebin the actual console output of the whole apt-get thing
pastebin does not work here, don't know why...
you mean the site doesn't load?
send? it should just give you a page, and then you give me the URL of it
anyway, try "pastebin" on google, there are others around
It says query failure...
*shrug* works for me right now
there's http://pastebin.ca/ for instance
Query failure: Can't open file: 'pastebin.MYI'. (errno: 145)
could just be a temporary glitch, have you tried again? anyway, use pastebin.ca if it keeps doing that
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/17070/
I tried a few times... Now I found this ubuntu paste bin
?! that *is* our pastebin
it's the one i've been talking about all along.
try reading the channel topic :P
Sorry for that.

This happened to me before and I found some info on the ubuntu forums that helped get rid of the problem. Yet I am amazed that it does not install at all and is so hard to remove. Am I the only one trying to install the player?

it installed ok for me. the problem seems to be network related, like the subnet that vmplayer tries to use is busy or something. give me 1) the output of "cat /etc/network/interfaces"  and 2) try "sudo invoke-rc.d vmware-player stop" followed by the dpkg -r again
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/17071/
I will try plugging in the cable for the wired connection.
no, won't be any use
if you type  sudo apt-get dist-upgrade , does it complain about anything?
